Original question:
Hydrofluoric acid reacts with calcium carbonate according to the following equation:
2HF(aq) + CaCO3 → H2O(l) + CO2(g) + CaF2
If 100 mL of a 10mM solution of HF is added to 100 mL of a 10mM solution of CaCO3, how much CaF2 will precipitate? Assume the reaction goes to completion.
